Question_1.Context: The study investigated the toxic effects of TiO2 NRs and TiO2 NRs loaded with Ag or Au NPs on boar spermatozoa.
Question_1.Question: What was the observed effect on sperm motility after incubation with Ag-TiO2 NRs compared to controls?
Question_1.Source: After incubation for 2 h, motility was significantly greater for non-treated controls than in the other groups, and the motility of sperm incubated with 20 μg/ml of Ag-TiO2 NRs was significantly less than in the other groups.

Question_2.Context: The study assessed sperm viability and acrosomal integrity after incubation with TiO2 NRs, Ag-TiO2 NRs, or Au-TiO2 NRs.
Question_2.Question: What was the effect on sperm viability after treatment with 20 μg/ml Ag-TiO2 NRs compared to controls?
Question_2.Source: Percentages of viable sperm were higher after treatment with 10 μg/ml Au-TiO2 NRs and for controls than after treatment with 20 μg/ml Ag-TiO2 NRs.

Question_3.Context: The study examined the intracellular ROS levels in spermatozoa exposed to TiO2 NRs, Ag-TiO2 NRs, or Au-TiO2 NRs.
Question_3.Question: Which treatment resulted in significantly higher intracellular ROS levels in spermatozoa?
Question_3.Source: Interestingly, ROS levels were found to be significantly higher after treatment with Ag-TiO2 NRs than for the other treatments.

Question_4.Context: The study investigated the fertilization rates and embryo developments of oocytes inseminated with sperm incubated with TiO2 NRs, Ag-TiO2 NRs, or Au-TiO2 NRs.
Question_4.Question: Which treatment resulted in the lowest blastocyst formation rate?
Question_4.Source: When oocytes were fertilized with spermatozoa incubated with 20 μg/ml Ag-loaded TiO2 NRs, the lowest blastocyst rates were observed.

Question_5.Context: The study examined the electron transfer mechanism in spermatozoa exposed to Ag-loaded TiO2 NRs.
Question_5.Question: What is the role of NADPH in the electron transfer mechanism?
Question_5.Source: We observed higher ROS levels when NADPH (0.2 mM) and Ag-loaded TiO2 NRs were treated in combination; ROS production was low when only NADPH was administered.

Question_6.Context: The study assessed the effect of Ag or Au NPs incorporated on TiO2 NRs on boar spermatozoa.
Question_6.Question: What was the observed effect on sperm viability after treatment with 10 μg/ml Au-TiO2 NRs compared to controls?
Question_6.Source: Percentages of viable sperm were higher after treatment with 10 μg/ml Au-TiO2 NRs and for controls than after treatment with 20 μg/ml Au-TiO2 NRs.

Question_7.Context: The study examined the charge transfer mechanism and ROS generation in spermatozoa exposed to Ag-loaded TiO2 NRs.
Question_7.Question: What is the proposed charge transfer mechanism between living cells and Ag-TiO2 NRs?
Question_7.A: Electron transfer from Ag-TiO2 NRs to living cells
Question_7.B: Electron transfer from living cells to Ag-TiO2 NRs
Question_7.C: Proton transfer from Ag-TiO2 NRs to living cells
Question_7.D: Proton transfer from living cells to Ag-TiO2 NRs
Question_7.Source: The electron donor ligand of Ag NP might accept the transmembrane electrons of sperm enzymatic NADPH after mitochondrial electron transport chain reactions have been disrupted.

Question_8.Context: The study investigated the effects of Ag or Au NPs incorporated on TiO2 NRs on boar spermatozoa.
Question_8.Question: What was the observed effect on sperm motility after incubation with 10 μg/ml Au-TiO2 NRs compared to controls?
Question_8.Source: The percentage of total motile sperm after 10 min of incubation was higher for sperm treated with 10 μg/ml Au-TiO2 NRs than for sperm treated with 20 μg/ml Ag-TiO2 NRs.

Question_9.Context: The study assessed the intracellular ROS levels in spermatozoa exposed to TiO2 NRs, Ag-TiO2 NRs, or Au-TiO2 NRs.
Question_9.Question: Which treatment resulted in significantly lower intracellular ROS levels in spermatozoa?
Question_9.Source: ROS levels were found to be significantly higher after treatment with Ag-TiO2 NRs than for the other treatments.

Question_10.Context: The study examined the fertilization rates and embryo developments of oocytes inseminated with sperm incubated with TiO2 NRs, Ag-TiO2 NRs, or Au-TiO2 NRs.
Question_10.Question: Which treatment resulted in the highest cleavage rate after in vitro fertilization?
Question_10.Source: We observed more cleaved oocytes from IVF performed using control sperm than in the other groups.
